intro: Sphaerostephanos sarasinorum, commonly known as the Sarasin's starfruit, is a rare and striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often orange or red in color, resembling a starfruit in appearance. Native to specific regions in Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, it is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
